text: check out these five automation workflow
tips in Ableton if you want something to
sound natural then you should automate
things by hand hit this button up here
make sure that you don't have any tracks
armed so turn this off and then you'll
just need to hit record and you can see
that it's going to automate that for you
and this way you can use your ears as
opposed to just drawing a line so
there's this thing up here called
automation block and if you click that
on that allows you to edit the actual
clip without destroying the automation
that's behind it if I turn this off now
and then move this clip around you can
see that's actually going to copy the
automation with it so if you right click
any node and actually hit edit value
here you can actually just type in the
value so for instance I want this to be
at zero decibel so it fades up easy as
that if you want to move a whole bunch
of nodes at once you can highlight a
section and drag your mouse close to the
line and then you can drag all of them
up and down at the same time and my
favorite if you want to filter a
particular section of your Arrangement
go over to your audio filter and turn it
off first show The automation get your
pencil tool out and then you can really
easily just turn it on in the section
that you want it
